intro: Ulmus taihangshanensis, commonly known as the Taihangshan elm, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Ulmaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and smooth, gray bark. The tree typically grows in mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and temperate climates. It is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
